content.description:
Aeneas and Dido in the Underworld

Tandem corripuit sese atque inimica refugitrefugio, -ere = fugio, -ere 
in nemus umbriferumumbrifer, -a, -um, adj.: shady, coniunx ubi pristinuspristinus, -a, -um, adj.: former illi 
respondet curis aequatque SychaeusSychaeus, -i, m.: Sychaeus amorem. 
Nec minus Aeneas casu percussuspercutio, -ere, -cussi, -cussum = pulso, -are iniquoiniquus, -a, -um, adj.: unfair 

prosequiturprosequor, -i = sequor, -i lacrimis longe et miseraturmiseror, -ari: to pity euntem.

Aeneid 6.472-476
content.question: Translate the passage as literally as possible.
